result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:24 AM Defendant Angela Jeanette Scott in court, in custody.  Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby appeared by phone for Angela Jeanette Scott.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State extended an offer prior to Court today, does not include Ms. Scott's new case. 
Defendant informs the Judge that she has not been getting medication she needs- Court will email the jail administrator. Defendant request a signature bond- Court denies bond request.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.

w/ 21CF749 & 22CF10

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Comply with day reporting requirements - UA's

10:08 AM Defendant Angela Jeanette Scott not in court.  Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby appeared by phone for Angela Jeanette Scott.  Attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Umpleby sent an email to the court his morning that Deft was rushed to hospital and has emergency CT scan at 10am this morning.
Court notes Deft is in the hospital every time a bond hearing is scheduled. 
Atty Umpleby notes he has not received any correspondence since 9:40am this morning.
State leaves to discretion of the Court.
Atty Umpleby notes Deft has continued suboxone treatments and has signed all releases and thought the information would be conveyed to Day Reporting.
Requesting a global offer and updates Deft's address.
Court notes Day Reporting has not been compliant and Deft has not appeared.
Court issues Bench Warrants in all cases and when picked up on warrants, Court Commissioner can decide bond.
